item.title: Haiti earthquake: Tensions rise in struggle to get aid to victims
item.description: Five days after a powerful earthquake struck, hundreds are missing and people are desperate for aid.

item.title: 'We felt free': Cubans remain defiant in face of protest crackdown
item.description: A month after rare anti-government protests in Cuba, many of those who took part remain defiant.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Search for survivors amid devastation
item.description: Almost 2,000 people are known to have died in Saturday's powerful earthquake.

item.title: Cuba tightens control of internet after protests
item.description: Critics say the new rules are aimed at stifling dissent following mass anti-government demonstrations.

item.title: Venezuela opposition politician Guevara freed after talks
item.description: Freddy Guevara is freed after two days of talks between opposition and government representatives.

item.title: Nicaragua: Police raid offices of La Prensa newspaper
item.description: It comes a day after La Prensa said authorities were withholding its supplies of paper and ink.

item.title: US-Mexico border migrant detention levels reach 21-year high
item.description: Migrant numbers usually dip during the hot summer months, but July has continued an upward trend.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: The forgotten villages cut off from help
item.description: The tremor razed their homes, but these survivors could still die for a lack of basic supplies.

item.title: Brazil hopes we all get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaÃ§a falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Postcard from Chile arrives in Dorset after 30 years
item.description: The recipient says he was 'slightly confused' when it landed on his doormat three decades late.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: 'Lionel Messi feels betrayed by Barcelona' - the inside track on new PSG star's Nou Camp exit
item.description: Read the inside track on how Lionel Messi's Barcelona exit came about, with the club legend said to feel betrayed.

item.title: No help for these Haiti residents five days after earthquake
item.description: Five days after the earthquake that killed more than 2,000 people, many are still waiting for help.

item.title: Haiti struck by deadly 7.2-magnitude earthquake
item.description: A powerful earthquake has struck the Caribbean nation of Haiti, killing at least 304 people.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.

item.title: 'Quicker, faster, better!' - Thompson-Herah's 'double-double'
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah confirms her place among the pantheon of sprint greats as she completes an Olympic 100m-200m double for the second time with a sensational victory in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid vaccines: Tourists head to the US to get vaccinated
item.description: Some tourists are spending thousands of dollars to travel to the US to get a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Petrol bombs thrown at Cuban embassy in Paris
item.description: Cuba's foreign ministry has released surveillance footage of the attack at its embassy in France.
